name: David Letterman
monologue: Today was so beautiful that air traffic controllers were napping in the park.

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Katie Couric Future Plans

name: Jay Leno
monologue: A new poll shows that President Obama’s approval rating is down to 41 percent. A lot of people that voted for him now say they liked him a lot better when he was a Democrat.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: The United States is sending its most powerful drone to Libya. That’s a long trip for Joe Biden.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Former New Mexico Gov. Gary Johnson has announced that he will run for president in 2012. His campaign slogan: “Even I’ve never heard of me.”

name: Jay Leno
monologue: House Speaker John Boehner said that President Obama needs to grow up. And then he burst into tears.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The Libyan government says Moammar Gadhafi is still in “high spirits,” even though his compound was destroyed this week. Most people would be devastated, but here’s the thing — he’s insane.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: It was just revealed that Donald Trump hasn’t voted in primary elections in over 20 years. Or in simpler terms, Trump hasn’t voted in primary elections in over three wives.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Facebook just launched the “send” button, which lets you share Web articles with particular groups of friends.  That’s good, because when I log onto Facebook, my first thought is, “Not enough people sending me things.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: While the cast of “Jersey Shore” shoots in Italy, they will be banned from drinking alcohol in public. Or as Snooki put it, “Is it possible to eat alcohol?”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Entertainment Tonight has been covering the royal wedding since before Prince William and Kate Middleton even met.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: One of Charlie Sheen’s “goddesses” broke up with him because she wants to live in a less dangerous environment. So she moved into the puma exhibit at the San Diego Zoo.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The same day that Charlie Sheen loses a goddess, all of a sudden, Katie Couric announces that she’s leaving CBS News. Coincidence?

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Donald Trump is now attacking President Obama’s grades, suggesting that he was a poor student. First it was the birth certificate, and now the grades. Trump won’t be happy until he proves that Obama doesn’t exist.
